text.0: come be thou mitra varuṇa or pūṣan come o bṛhaspati to mine oblation.
text.1: with maruts vasus or Ādityas make thou parjanya pour for santanu his raindrops.
text.2: the god intelligent the speedy envoy whom thou hast sent hath come to me devapi.
text.3: address thyself to me and turn thee hither within thy lips will i put brilliant language.
text.4: within my mouth bṛhaspati deposit speech lucid vigorous and free from weakness.
text.5: thereby to win for santanu the rainfall the meathrich drop from heaven hath passed within it.
text.6: let the sweet drops descend on us o indra give us enough to lade a thousand wagons.
text.7: sit to thy hotar task pay worship duly and serve the gods devapi with oblation.
text.8: knowing the gods goodwill devapi Ṛṣi the son of rstisena sate as hotar.
text.9: he hath brought down from heavens most lofty summit the ocean of the rain celestial waters.
text.10: gathered together in that highest ocean the waters stood by deities obstructed.
text.11: they burried down set free by arstisena in gaping clefts urged onward by devapi.
text.12: when as chief priest for santanu devapi chosen for hotars duty prayed beseeching.
text.13: graciously pleased bṛhaspati vouchsafed him a voice that reached the gods and won the waters.
text.14: o agni whom devapi arstisena the mortal man hath kindled in his glory.
text.15: joying in him with all the gods together urge on the sender of the rain parjanya.
text.16: all ancient Ṛṣis with their songs approached thee even thee o muchinvoked at sacrifices.
text.17: we have provided wagonloads in thousands come to the solemn rite lord of red horses.
text.18: the wagonloads the nineandninety thousand these have been offered up to thee o agni.
text.19: hero with these increase thy many bodies and stimulated send us rain from heaven.
text.20: give thou these ninety thousand loads o agni to indra to the bull to be his portion.
text.21: knowing the paths which deities duly travel set mid the gods in heaven aulana also.
text.22: o agni drive afar our foes our troubles chase malady away and wicked demons.
text.23: from this airocean from the lofty heavens send down on us a mighty flood of waters.
